templates: ${name}'s ${worker} produces ${rate} ${items} per hour when running at full capacity. After working continuously for ${time} hours, all the ${items} need to be packed into ${workers} ${targets} for shipping to customers. If each ${target_singular} gets the same number of ${items}, how many ${items} go in each ${target_singular}?

${A_worker} at ${name}'s factory can make ${rate} ${items} every hour when running smoothly without any interruptions. It runs for ${time} hours straight, then the ${items} are divided equally among ${workers} ${targets} for distribution. How many ${items} are placed in each ${target_singular}?

${name} owns ${a_worker} that produces ${rate} ${items} per hour at ${his_her} small business. After ${time} hours of continuous operation, ${subject} distributes the finished ${items} equally into ${workers} ${targets} for delivery to various stores. How many ${items} does each ${target_singular} contain?

The ${worker} in ${name}'s workshop makes ${rate} ${items} every hour when operating normally. ${name} runs it for ${time} hours straight to complete a big order, then splits all the finished ${items} equally among ${workers} ${targets} for shipping. How many ${items} go in each ${target_singular}?
